project.teaser: Reincarnate aims at enabling the European construction industry to significantly reduce construction and demolition waste (CDW) by providing a circular potential assessment information model platform (CP-IM) and a set of innovations to make use of the CP-IM. The CP-IM will...
project.objective: Reincarnate aims at enabling the European construction industry to significantly reduce construction and demolition waste (CDW) by providing a circular potential assessment information model platform (CP-IM) and a set of innovations to make use of the CP-IM. The CP-IM will provide a digital representation of building materials and products with life-cycle information and prediction methods for tracing and predicting the lifetime of a products / material. The CP-IM will also allow for assessing the potential for lifetime extension and reuse and possibilities to predict circular value flows. Based on the CP-IM REINCARNATE will develop and demonstrate ten innovations that use CP-IM data, ranging from innovations for building inspection, to solutions for planning construction and dismantling, to automatically identifying and sorting CDW, to decision support tools for architects and real estate managers. The innovations will draw upon emerging digital technologies, such as digital twin representation, artificial intelligence, and robotic automation. REINCARNATE will also develop detailed social science insights about the social adoption behavior existing in the wider construction industry that will allow for understanding how a wide realization within the industry can be established that building products and materials can be reincarnated and re-used in high product quality. All innovations will be demonstrated on five selected demonstrators. Business process guidelines, an online learning platform with training materials and proposals for standards will be developed to additional foster widespread dissemination and exploitation of the REINCARNATE results. The REINCARNATE consortium combines 16 partners from different EU member countries and Hong Kong with strong expertise in digital twins, lifecycle prediction, material assessment, social sciences, construction management, architecture, and real estate management.
project.title: Reincarnation of construction products and materials by slowing down and extending cycles
project.keywords: Circular value flows, avoiding waste, information management

result.title: Valuation of recycled materials
result.description: A technical report describing data-driven methods for for providing models for the status and expected lifetime of construction materials.

result.title: REINCARNATE Impact Assessment and Exploitation Interim
result.description: Interim impact assessment report.

result.title: Circular decision making for adaptive refurbishment and renovation of real estate assets
result.description: A report targeted to asset managers and building owners proposing architectural concepts for the adaptive reuse of buildings

result.title: Presenting SLAMD - A Sequential Learning Based Software for the Inverse Design of Sustainable Cementitious Materials

details.authors: Christoph Völker, Benjamí Moreno Torres, Ghezal Ahmad Zia, Rafia Firdous

result.title: Integrated information management for circular value flow planning
result.description: Processes to manage information to allow for the strategic management of circular value flows

result.title: Business eco-systems for circular markets: maturity, transformation, and mapping
result.description: A report proposing maturity models for various stakeholder groups allowing to evaluate the readiness of actors for participating in circular value chains. A set of user journey maps will also be presented.

result.title: An ontology for circular management of buildings
result.description: A technical report targeted towards software developers proposing ontologies, information models, and processes for setting up information platforms to support circular management.

result.title: Circular decision making for extending the use life of real estate assets
result.description: A technical report targeted towards asset management organizations and building owners proposing concepts for renovating buildings. The report will also describe the circular decision making for real estate assets innovation and how it integrates with the CP-IM.

result.title: What matters when? – An integrative literature review on decision criteria in different stages of the adaptive reuse process

details.authors: Brian van Laar, Hilde Remøy, Angela Greco, Vincent Gruis

result.title: Parametric design tool for reused building parts and recycled materials
result.description: A parametric modeling tool that allows for designing and re-designing buildings considering available building components and recycables.

result.title: Methods for BIM supported dismantling
result.description: A technical report targeted to construction professionals proposing concepts for de-installing and dismantling product and components for re-use.

result.title: REINCARNATE Impact Master Plan
result.description: A report proposing an initial plan for reaching the envisioned impact of Reincarnate

result.title: Standardization Plan
result.description: Standardization Plan

result.title: REINCARNATE Dissemination and Communication Interim
result.description: Interim dissemination and communication report

result.title: Advanced valuation models for recycled materials
result.description: A scientific report summarizing the early explorations of using data about recycled materials for designing new high-performance materials

result.title: Upgrade solutions for construction products
result.description: A technical / scientific report on data-driven methods to asses material characteristics over the lifetime of materials.

result.title: Probabilistic methods for lifecycle assessment and prediction of buildings and construction products
result.description: A scientific report proposing a set of methods and algorithms for risk-based assessment and prediction of the lifetime of components/products

result.title: Lean construction resource planning
result.description: A technical report targeted towards construction companies proposing a set of lean construction resource planning concepts and methods and describing the BIM supported lean construction resource planning innovation and how it integrates with the CP-IM.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - Reincarnate (Reincarnation of construction products and materials by slowing down and extending cycles)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The average lifespan of a building is 39 years — in Europe, it is only 25-30 years — and the main reason for demolition is obsolescence. This is why there is a large amount of construction and demolition waste (CDW) — representing approximately 25-30% of all waste in...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Launch version CP-IM Platform (Software)
result.description: A first version of the CP-IM based on the IoT platform of partner MFX is online and is able to receive and store data.

result.title: Adoption pathways for circular innovations in the construction industry
result.description: A report reviewing and evaluating existing circular waste reduction practices to propose a set of validated guidelines to overcome actor network barriers for the adoption of circular innovations.

result.title: Data driven design of alkali-activated concrete using sequential learning

details.authors: Christoph Völker, Benjami Moreno Torres, Tehseen Rug, Rafia Firdous, Ghezal Ahmad Jan Zia, Stefan Lüders, Horacio Lisdero Scaffino, Michael Höpler, Felix Böhmer, Matthias Pfaff, Dietmar Stephan, Sabine Kruschwitz

result.title: Concreting a sustainable future: A dataset of alkali-activated concrete and its properties

details.authors: Benjamí Moreno Torres, Christoph Völker, Rafia Firdous

result.title: A set of methods for economic and ecological appraisal of circular economy innovations
result.description: A technical report proposing a set of financial-economic appraisal methods for actors interesting in developing sound business models around the marketing of reusable products and materials.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
